provocatively adverb
(TO CAUSE THOUGHT)

in a way that causes thought about interesting subjects: The comics featured stories that dealt provocatively with the environment, racism, and sex. A woman was provocatively cast in the lead role.

(TO CAUSE ANGER)
in a way that causes an angry reaction, usually intentionally: He said that people would be allowed to protest peacefully, but not provocatively. The missiles are placed provocatively close to the border.
